page.title: 15THE PENDLE WITCHES IN SABDEN
page.content: In the early{1600's}there lived two families on{Pendle}Hill.Both families hated each other,and both of the women were suspected of{supernatural}powers. {Old Demdike}and{Chattox}were sent for trial at{Lancaster}by a man with the name of{Roger Nowel}of{Read Hall. {Demdike}and{Chattox}were both accused of being witches and were both found guilty along with{Alice Nutter}another {Pendle}witch.The hanging took place at {Lancaster}on{August the 20th,1612.} Other{Pendle}witches as well as{ {Demdike,Chattox and Alice Nutter}were found guilty and hung on the same dayand at the same{time.Demdike and {Chattox}both lived on{Pendle hill.} {Demdike}lived with her daughter in an old house named {Malkin Tower}and when the trial took place{Demdike}was{80} years old and blind. {THOMAS FLANAGAN.
